_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: 49 C.F.R. Part 178; Portland Fire Code; Oregon Specialty Structural Code;
_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: We assume ASME and ASTM standards were adhered to due to the building codes followed.
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: Emergency Response Plan, Emergency Response Exercise Program, Operator Work Instructions (OWIs), Regular Inspections, Audits.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0	The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at High Purity Products (HPP) on Airport Way in Portland, OR:

1.1	Accidental Release Prevention. 

1.1.1	Receiving, Shipping and Warehousing procedures outlining proper and safe work practices to ensure safe and compliant execution of the process.
1.1.1.1	New chemical approval procedure.
1.1.1.2	Container inspection, upon arrival, to ensure integrity.
1.1.1.3	On Hold and lockout/tag out procedures.
1.1.1.4	Personal protective equipment plan.

1.1.2	Diptube change procedure outlining proper and safe work practices to ensure safe and compliant execution of the process. 
1.1.2.1	Personal protective equipment plan.
1.1.2.2	Clean Room Gowning/De-Gowning Procedure.

2.0	HPP's facility and the regulated substances covered by 40 CFR Part 68. 

2.1	HPP's facility, on Airport Way, is a storage facility where we store and ship Hydrochloric Acid in sealed containers, in quantities exceeding the threshold, per 49 CFR Part 68.
2.2	We also place dip tubes in some of these containers.
2.3	HPP's Airport Way facility.
2.3.1	HPP has a generator to ensure life safety equipment is operational in the event of a power outage. 
2.3.2	The storage area is surrounded by containment curbing to prevent a release to the environment. 

2.3.3	The facility is rated as an H-4 storage area per the International Building Code (IBC). 

3.0	HPP's accidental release prevention program. 

3.1	Process Safety Management Plan

3.1.1	Employees are put through an extensive training and complete tests to ensure competency before they can work around a regulated process. 
3.1.2	Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) is performed before the implementation of a new process. 
3.1.3	Pre-start up safety review is completed after the PHA. 
3.1.4	An extensive list of operating procedures to ensure the safest practices while working. 
3.1.5	Contractor safety procedures to ensure optimum safety. 
3.1.6	Preventative maintenance program. 
3.1.7	Procedures for ma

nagement of change. 
3.1.8	Incident documentation and investigation to determine root cause of the incident and make preventative improvements. 
3.1.9	Compliance audits to ensure continued compliance and safety.

4.0	Five-year accident history. 

4.1	HPP has never had an accidental release of Hydrochloric Acid at HPP's Airport Way location. 

5.0	Emergency response.

5.1	HPP has a policy to ensure a certain number of HAZWOPPER trained personnel onsite while the facility is open for operation.

5.2	Overview of regulations pertaining to accidental release reporting and other safe     practices to ensure the safety of the employees, the surrounding civilians and environment. 

5.3	Predetermined incident command structure. 

5.3.1	On-Site Incident commander is ultimately responsible for the coordination of the emergency plan and assumes leadership duties. 
5.3.2	Evacuation coordinator reports to On-Site Incident Commander and ensures facility is evacuated, determines primary assembly point, etc.
5.3.3	Safety Officer is responsible for the overall safety of the emergency response operation. Ultimately, these duties can be assumed by the On-Site Incident Commander. 

6.0	Planned and recent changes to improve safety. 

6.1	The implementation of randomized safety and compliance inspections. 

6.2	HPP is looking at involving the local Fire Department in our emergency & incident response training. 

6.3	A Compliance Director position was recently place into HPP's management structure to ensure and improve the overall safety and compliance of HPP. 


7.0	HPP is committed to ensuring the safest practices are consistently executed to ensure the safety of its employees, the surrounding community and the environment.
